meanings.definition: Conforming to a type or standard
meanings.sent1: The typic car had four wheels and a steering wheel.
meanings.sent2: Her behavior was typic of a responsible student.
meanings.sent3: It was typic for him to always arrive early to meetings.
meanings.sent4: The typic house on the street stood out with its bright red door.
meanings.sent5: The typic sunset painted the sky in shades of pink and orange.

meanings.sent1: The movie was a typic example of a romantic comedy.
meanings.sent2: His actions were typic of someone trying to avoid trouble.
meanings.sent3: It was typic for her to always forget her keys at home.
meanings.sent4: The typic scene in the painting captured a serene countryside.
meanings.sent5: The typic student in the class always asked insightful questions.

meanings.sent1: The typic font used in the book was easy to read.
meanings.sent2: Her typic design for the poster caught everyone's attention.
meanings.sent3: It was typic for him to spend hours choosing the right font.
meanings.sent4: The typic layout of the magazine made it visually appealing.
meanings.sent5: The typic style of the logo reflected modern trends in typography.
